metadata.titel_preek: Easter Season: The Triumph of the Word over Night and Dust

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enters the realm of Death/Night to rescue humanity from the 'cold clasp of death' and the 'tomb of hope,' establishing a new reality through the Resurrection.

tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The rising sun revealed the victory already accomplished.
God has entered our pain and been wounded by it... yet has been raised triumphant.

object.identificatie: Life, Light, and the Restoration of the Human Subject from 'Dust'
tekstueel_bewijs: receive the gift of eternal light and life in his name
grant his divine life to all who come to him

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The 'Really God' (The Wholly Other)
tekstueel_bewijs: The Bible sets before us a baffling, even an infuriating God who is really God
to you and to me: 'Blessed are they who do not see and yet believe'

helper.identificatie: The Word / The Holy Spirit / The Wounds of Jesus
tekstueel_bewijs: it is the Word of Jesus that creates faith
through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith
the night in which Sin and Death reign
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is described as an 'irrevocable' and 'merciless' reign that 'obliterates every human hope,' requiring a divine Subject to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human struggle to believe (Faith vs. Doubt).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (represented by Thomas/Job)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (human faith) is entirely dependent on the primary program (God's revelation). Faith is not a work but a 'gift' received after the Subject (God) acts.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Holy Spirit → The Risen Christ ← Death/Satan

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Son of God... has been given over to the realm of night.
The Lord looks straight through Thomas.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Mary Magdalene came to the tomb.
We can choose a god who suits us.

voorbeelden: we must stare it in the face
Job's great longing is for revelation.
they did not know the scripture
having power to grant his divine life
God has a power that he cannot discern

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to act where humans are 'incompetent' (dead/dust). It is a theology of divine capacity.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Night) to ~S2 (Empty Tomb) to S1 (Risen Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's self-revelation (The 'Who') which transcends the 'Why'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; death is treated as a cosmic reality, not a psychological metaphor.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is rigorously theocentric. God is the primary actor; humans are consistently placed in the role of receivers or those whose 'mouths are stopped' by divine action.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Thomas stands for all of us here.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
I will be quiet, comforted that I am dust.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are used as 'types' of human helplessness or doubt, not as moral examples to follow.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God meets them in their failure.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'doing' is replaced by the 'gift' of being found.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace: God acts, man receives.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Night' of John to the 'Dust' of Job is masterfully handled through the actant of the 'Revealing God'.
spanning_punten: The tension between human 'Why' and Divine 'Who'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked to the 'Power of Darkness' and 'Death', making it an ontological trap rather than just a mistake.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a consistent 'God-as-Subject' structure. The 'Opponent' (Death) is sufficiently heavy to make the 'Subject's' (Christ) victory meaningful.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for an Easter sermon.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a textbook example of a grace-oriented sermon. It avoids the trap of turning faith into a human work by identifying the Holy Spirit as the actant who creates faith through the Word.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Night' imagery, Greimasian analysis reveals that 'Night' functions as a specific Actantial Opponent that only a Divine Subject can defeat.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek/Hebrew context; this analysis shows how the sermon's 'engine' moves the hearer from a state of 'Dust' to 'Life'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Word' is not just information but a 'Helper' actant that provides the 'Pouvoir-croire' (Power to believe) to the incompetent human subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids 'Exemplarism' by treating Thomas and Job as recipients of revelation rather than heroes of faith.
